CatDescriptText: Mrs. Elizabeth Hughes, housewife, St. Clair Village and Mr. Edwin Huminski, waiter, Carrick, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, April 21, 1962, pg. 6 with question: Do you think the Government should investigate Big Steel's hiking the price of steel?"  Mrs. Elizabeth Hughes' answer reads: "I think it should be.  Someone stands to profit other than the working man."  Mr. Edwin Huminski's answer reads: "No, I don't think they should and because of the simple fact that this is a free country and businessmen should have a free hand to do what they want.  Competition would take care of the prices...There should be a hands-off policy."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Elizabeth Hughes wearing dark coat with fur collar, standing in front of Empire Building, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Edwin Huminski wearing eyeglasses and bow tie, standing in front of Empire Building, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
